intro: Fimbristylis hispaniolica, commonly known as the Hispaniola sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its grass-like appearance, with slender, cylindrical stems and small, clustered inflorescences. Native to the Caribbean island of Hispaniola, it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and wetlands. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces tiny, three-lobed flowers that are typically greenish or brownish in color. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various invertebrates.
